ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Plane of Fear
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL.  I m only laughing because, should you ever get bored, hop on over to www.solusekro.org... where we have TRIED to have such a system.  I agree that they
ygData.messageBody:
LOL. I'm only laughing because, should you ever get bored, hop on over to
www.solusekro.org...
where we have TRIED to have such a system. I agree that they can work
remarkably well most of the time, but on Sol Ro, well, lets just say things
have become less than friendly many a time. Problem is there are SO many
guild that can do any plane that the reservation system would be 3 to 4
MONTHS in advance (and this is for weeknights). Most guilds do tend to go
to a plane for a week though. Our arguments usually are about one guild
"stealing" the plane from another. Its REALLY fun! (sarcasm intended) :)

Halana 55th Shaman and Master Raptor Killer
Tani 27th Blueberry
Paradigm - the - plane - stealing - guild (yes, sarcasm again)
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 28, 2000 1:41 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Plane of Fear
>
>
> Some random PoF thoughts:
>
> On Innoruuk, we have a player based "summit" where the
> "major" guilds met
> and hashed out some basic rules and a reservation system for
> PoF and PoH
> (PoS is considered FFA [free for all] as are draggins.) Guilds can
> "reserve" 2 dates (16 hour slots) for planes and the others
> respect their
> times See www.innoruuk.com and follow the link to the summit
> rules. There's
> also a calendar there - you can see who has what booked when.
> Weeekends get
> booked month's in advance. If a date is not booked, you and
> your pals can
> hop in and have a FFA night if you so desire. This has
> worked remarkably
> well for us.
>
> Last Friday, I heard through the grapevine that some folks
> had a total wipe
> out trying to break PoF at the south west wall (why they
> chose sw - I have
> no clue). So, a bunch of our guild mustered forces and we
> went in to break
> the west wall and start them doing CR. We had like 3 groups and were
> cutting down mobs nicely when the server decided to lag out for a good
> minute. When it let up, we were all dead. Heh, some of us were so
> confident of the break that we did not bother to bind
> anywhere close so it
> took a bit for us to get back to the TV and hop on in
> virtually naked. We
> looted down to res corpses and finished the break. Then came the most
> dangerous part: bringing the other guild's folks back in. It
> can be a real
> nightmare when inexperienced people who you can't easily
> communicate with
> start running around in a panic. Anyhow, we got them set and
> gated on out.
>
> We got a couple higher level folks on our server who like to
> brag about how
> few ppl they can break PoF with. Well, whoopity do, when you
> go in with 2
> groups of high level pet casters and fight blue mobs til it
> looks bad then
> gate out to the TV, rinse repeat. And their story is always
> the same: "we
> cleared PoF with 10 ppl, except for the Temple, CT & Dracho
> and some misc
> roamers far from where we were..." All I can say is: "we clear PoF
> completely, kill Dracho, pull Temple w/o a sacrifical person,
> kill CT and
> are done by 1am on a weeknight." Another guild has done it
> in like 3 hours.
> Having mid 50 to 60 level ppl makes all the difference. When
> we were capped
> at 50, CT was dieing but it was 5am or later sometimes.
>
> Sylly Songsynger
> <The Pantheon>
> Minstrel somewhere on Innoruuk...
> http://www.sba.uwm.edu/jgs/sylly
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Greg Gillan" <ggillan@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Monday, August 28, 2000 11:10 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Plane of Fear
>
>
> > I can see where Sartori is coming from, and while you may have taken
> offense
> > to his response, you shouldn't have. I'm guessing here, but I think
> Sartori
> > comes from a day when if you wanted to do fear, you had to break it
>
